message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of private information retrieval (PIR) over a distributed storage system, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the tradeoff between optimal retrieval cost and storage cost, which is related to cryptography (cs.CR) and coding theory (cs.CC). Finally, the paper presents a generalized result for PIR with coded databases, which could be of interest to researchers in the field of information retrieval (cs.IR).
